itemLabel: Jane Campbell, Baroness Campbell of Surbiton
itemDescription: Campaigner and adviser for disability reforms (born 1959)

wikipedia_page.main: Jane Susan Campbell, Baroness Campbell of Surbiton,  (born 19 April 1959) is a British disability rights campaigner and life peer. She was Commissioner of the Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) from 2006 to 2008. She also served as Chair of the Disability Committee which led on to the EHRC Disability Programme. She was the former Chair of the Social Care Institute for Excellence (SCIE).  She was Commissioner of the Disability Rights Commission until it was wound up in October 2006.

response: * Jane Campbell, Baroness Campbell of Surbiton – British peer and Commissioner of the Equality and Human Rights Commission

response: A contributor for many academic texts on disability and a podcaster of note for the podcast on disability and film Darke is currently working on three documentaries on 'Disabled Activism' with Miro Griffiths funded by Leverhulme, the "Home and Disabled People' with the Museum of the Home in London, and an anti-assisted suicide project that will include contributions from Liz Carr and Jane Campbell, Baroness Campbell of Surbiton.
